lines.text: When people hassle me about actually liking airplane or cafeteria food, I try to explain to them, I grew up with a divorced working mom who never had the patience for anything fresh. Frozen or packaged is what I was weened on. Except for when she made her one dish - disguised a hundred different ways. Chicken. Chicken Cacciatore, Chicken Florentine, Hawaiian Chicken...
How do you tell your mother she's in denial when her only response is, "I am not".
